required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Pelvis Diameters as a Predictor for the Mode of Delivery ,Using Non-invasive, Ultrasound Based Measurements
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Pelvis Diameters as a Predictor for the Mode of Delivery ,Using Non-invasive, Ultrasound Based Measurements.

brief_summary.textblock: Assessing the relation between the Pelvis diameters measured by the LaborPro, and the mode of delivery(normal vaginal delivery/instrumental delivery/Caesarean section.

detailed_description.textblock: Assessing the relation between the Pelvis diameters measured by the LaborPro, and the mode of delivery(normal vaginal delivery/instrumental delivery/Caesarean section.

primary_outcome.measure: pelvis measurements influence on the Delivery mode
primary_outcome.description: pregnant woman's during a routine visit in the ultrasound unit will be requested to sign a concent and will undergo pelvic measurement using the LaborPro system. statistic analysis will ensue in order to ascertain the relationship between pelvic measurement and the mode of delivery.

secondary_outcome.measure: the influence of maternal parameters on delivery mode.
secondary_outcome.description: Assessing the influence of relevant obstetric and maternal parameters on delivery mode in relation to the study measured parameters

intervention.intervention_name: pelvic measurements using the LaborPro Device
intervention.description: pelvic measurements using the LaborPro Device,ultrasound non invasive measurements

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A subject is eligible to participate in the study if she meets all of the following inclusion criteria:
- Singleton pregnancy
- Pregnant adult woman in labor
- Willing to participate in the study and understands the study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- A subject is not eligible for participation in this study if he/she meets any of the following exclusion criteria scheduled for c/s active infection
